sections.heading: Why Law Firms Are Adding AI to Their Case Management Stack
paragraphs: Your case management platform tracks deadlines, contacts, and tasks — but it doesn't read a 300-page deposition or summarize a plaintiff's medical records. That work still falls on your team.

Most platforms handle the organizational layer — contacts, calendars, tasks, and file storage. But the actual legal case file processing happens manually. Someone still has to read the transcript, summarize the records, extract key data from discovery, and format everything for attorney review. This is where the majority of paralegal and associate time goes, and where AI delivers the greatest return.

Dodonai plugs into your existing workflow as the document processing layer. Upload files from your case management system, and Dodonai returns structured outputs — {{link:/deposition-summary-software/|deposition summaries}}, {{link:/ai-medical-record-summaries-chronologies/|medical chronologies}}, {{link:/ai-deposition-transcript-software/|searchable transcripts}}, and {{link:/dodonai-extract-and-draft-agents/|custom extracts}} — that your team can drop directly into case files, demand letters, discovery responses, and trial binders.
Dodonai doesn't replace your case management platform — it's the processing engine that makes everything inside it more useful.

sections.heading: Dodonai Tools for Law Firm Case Management

cards.title: Deposition Summary Generation
cards.description: Page-line or narrative summaries in minutes. Highlight key topics to tailor each summary to the issues that matter, then file the output directly in your case management system.

cards.title: Medical Record Chronologies

cards.title: E-Discovery Integration

items.title: Upload Case Documents
items.description: Upload transcripts, medical records, discovery documents, or any case files to Dodonai's secure platform. PDFs, Word files, text files, and scanned documents all accepted — no preprocessing required.

items.title: AI Processes and Structures the Content
items.description: Select the output type — deposition summary, medical chronology, transcript search, document extract, or e-discovery review. Add key topics, date ranges, or focus areas to customize for your case.

items.title: Export to Your Case Management System
items.description: Download as PDF, Word, Excel, or plain text and add it to your case file. Every output includes page references so attorneys can verify any data point against the original.

faq.question: Does Dodonai replace our case management software?
faq.answer: No. Dodonai complements your existing platform — it handles summarization, search, and extraction that case management software doesn't do. You keep using your current system for contacts, calendars, and file storage.

faq.question: What types of documents can Dodonai process for our cases?
faq.answer: Deposition transcripts, medical records, discovery documents, contracts, correspondence, and virtually any PDF or Word file. {{link:/ai-pdf-ocr/|AI OCR}} handles scanned and handwritten documents too.

faq.question: How does Dodonai handle security for law firm documents?
faq.answer: SOC 2 Type II certified, HIPAA compliant with signed BAAs, AES-256 encrypted. Your documents stay out of any training pipeline, and you decide when data gets deleted.

faq.question: Can multiple attorneys and paralegals use the same Dodonai account?
faq.answer: Yes. Team accounts let multiple users upload, access summaries, and manage work product from a shared credit pool. Admins control access and monitor usage.

faq.question: How much does Dodonai cost for a law firm?
faq.answer: Plans start at $30/month for 200 pages (Lite). Basic is $60/month for 1,000 pages, Pro is $100/month for 5,000 pages. Enterprise plans available. See our {{link:/pricing/|pricing page}} for details.

faq.question: What is the learning curve for integrating Dodonai into our workflow?
faq.answer: Most firms are operational within a day. Upload a document, select the output type, download the result. No technical setup or formal training needed.
